name: Mount Kearsarge Indian Museum
address: 105 Haverhill Rd., North Salem, NH 03073 (also has a location at Rt. 109 N., Wolfeboro, NH 03894)
description: A museum dedicated to preserving and presenting the history and culture of Native American peoples, with an emphasis on the Abenaki people of New Hampshire. It features artifacts, artwork, and exhibits

name: Abenaki Trails Project
description: An initiative founded in 2020 to educate the public about the positive influences of the Abenaki people and showcase Abenaki artistry. Darryl Peasley, an enrolled member of the Nulhegan Band of Abenaki, is a co-founder
services: Alaska-Native-owned Art moving in New-Hampshire consultation

name: Noki Pottery (Vicki Blanchard)
description: Vicki Blanchard, an Abenaki artist, creates pottery in her home studio, including contemporary work and rediscovered ancient pottery techniques

name: Debbie Bazin Dostie (Beadwork and Mandalas)
description: A New Hampshire native of Native American descent who works in traditional and contemporary beadwork and mandala creations

name: Collective49
